titleproper.value: Guide to the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Local 282, FORE (Fear of Reprisal Ends) Records <num>WAG.107</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-08T15:18:03</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Local 282, Fear of Reprisal Ends (FORE) Records

abstract.value: In the mid-1970s, a small group of Teamsters organized a reform group in Local 282 of the IBT. Though the small group of reformers never never won a majority of votes in the Local, they engaged in a protracted and well-publicized campaign to clean up the corrupt practices of its Local officers. The pressure and visibility created by their efforts resulted in a series of convictions, resignations and trusteeships. The collection includes news clippings, rank and file platforms, fliers, FORE publications, election ballots, correspondence, legal documents, NLRB proceedings, documents related to Local 282, including indictments, newsletters and news clippings.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Donated by Lawrence (Larry) Kudla, 1994. The accession number associated with this gift is 1994.017. In addition, Lee Olson contributed papers to the collection.

<list><item><bibref>Adler, Jerry. <title render="italic">High Rise.</title>New York: Harper Collins, 1993.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Corruption and Racketeering in the New York City Construction Industry. Interim Report by the New York State Organized Crime Task Force. Ithaca, NY: ILR Press, New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations, Cornell University, 1988.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Corruption and Racketeering in the New York City Construction Industry. Final Report to Governor Mario M. Cuomo. Ronald Goldstock, Director, New York State Organized Crime Task Force. December 1989.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Crowe, Kenneth C. <title render="italic">Collision: How the Rank and File Took Back the Teamsters.</title>New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, 1993.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>LaBotz, Dan. <title render="italic">Rank and File Rebellion: Teamsters for a Democratic Union.</title>New York: Routledge, Chapman & Hall (Verso), 1990.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Mass, Peter. <title render="italic">Underboss: Sammy the Bull Gravano's Story of Life in the Mafia.</title>New York: HarperCollins, 1997.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>O'Brien, Joseph F. and Kurins, Andris. <title render="italic">Boss of Bosses: the FBI and Paul Castellano.</title>New York: Dell Publishing, 1991.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Fitch, Robert, "Revolution in the Teamsters," <title render="italic">Tikkun,</title>Vol. 8, No.2, 1993.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Hall, Burton, "Which Side Are You On?" <title render="italic">New Politics,</title>Vol. III, No. 3, Summer, 1991.</bibref> </item><item><bibref>Salvatore, Nick, "Teamster Democracy: A Moment of Possibility," <title render="italic">New Politics,</title>Vol. III, No.2, Winter, 1991.</bibref> </item></list>

The Collection is organized topically. Larry Kudla maintained a scrapbook of materials related to FORE activities. These materials, including news clips, flyers, and other rank and file literature, have been removed from the scrapbook and copied for inclusion in the Collection.
